intro: Brassica intricata, commonly known as the curly kale or ornamental kale, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, curled leaves that can range in color from deep green to purple and red. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has a compact, bushy appearance. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in racemes, typical of the mustard family. Brassica intricata is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its vibrant foliage and hardy nature.
